title: Why was Singed disabled almost immediately due to a bug but Graves is still dashing everywhere?
body: I don't think Riot has even acknowledged Graves yet. I'm aware Singed's poison DOT is gamebreaking, but you'd think Graves's infinite dashes and stackable armor/magic resist would be too? He's been allowed to run rampant for at least a week now with no acknowledgement, disables or fixes either.

replies.body:
The Graves issue requires a scripting exploit. We're perma banning for it as a result given it's way over the line and extremely clear that someone's doing it deliberately. The Singed bug by contrast doesn't involve any file modifications and may not be a deliberate attempt to exploit on the user's part (in some cases it's just unavoidable).

Edit: I think we also had a fix for the Graves issue in last night's patch, though not 100% certain on that (might still be in testing to go out later).
Even so, why is it not worth it to disable him when it's most definitely skewing games? And on an individual basis, this skewing is way worse than the Singed bug.
It's in such few games that it isn't worth disabling him.  Same reason why Botrk wasn't disabled when people were using the exploit for it.
I lost lp to this though... {{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}
You could probably file a ticket with a rough time and the date, explaining your situation and they would probably reimburse you?

That's the main reason I can come up with, though it seems rather callous.

Alternative motivation may be confirming the abusers for the ban wave that will follow.

RIot isn't showing an insensitive and cruel disregard for others (yes, i looked it up.) There just protecting their game. "Graves was just the best option for the hacker, if you remove it, there are more items and champions to chose from... I just scared myself, i'm done, that's my two cents." a small section from the rant I sent Akali is SO HOT. Originally to laugh about it but the realization hit me of how much power a cheater actually has.

Very fair point. If Graves is just the most effective use of the exploit, it's better for us to live with the devil we know for now until Riot can get the whole exploit patched up. Hadn't thought of the possibility that there would be other ways to use the exploit as a fallback if Graves was disabled early.

Couldn't the Botrk hack been any activatable? such as Gunblade? let's get rid of it too, and any champion with a dash as well... and Azir for good measure! lol I see your point. just felt like elaborating on it (made me laugh). but why take away the tools when someone else abuses them? Riot disable champions because the tool is broken. It's there fault and there responsibility to fix it and make it fair for everyone. they're only doing there job. Infinite Graves dashes, what about infinite Lucian dashes! >.< Graves was just the best option for the hacker, if you remove it, there are more items and champions to chose from... I just scared myself, i'm done, that's my two cents.
I would think it's in so few games, that it doesn't really need to be disabled (AKA, 0.005% of games to make up a number.)

I seem to recall a certain Shen bug that kept him disabled in LCS for quite a while, despite it being a very rare occurrence. This one is pretty darn consistent, meaning that those abusing it are ruining games from the first minute to the last.

I'd like to see the reasoning behind allowing a small subset of games to be horribly skewed by malicious players rather than disabling 1/133rd of the champion pool for a weekend.

They would've had to disable Shen for a long time (multiple patches) then because it took them forever to fix the bug due to it's rare occurrence.  It was a game changing bug so it was better to keep him disabled for pro play.  It wasn't too big of a deal at the time because Shen wasn't all that powerful and wasn't Pick/Ban status.

Ya know, no one has said this yet, and it needs to be said, this failure by riot needs to be addressed as its a consistent failure by Riot over the last 6 years and its really simple.

Here's what you are telling the player base with your statement here: Graves' exploit is so egregious an offense in League of Legends that players who are abusing it will be permanently suspended... AFTER they use the exploit and ruin another group of players' games and negatively impact their ranking.

Where the FUCK is competitive integrity here? A champ that barely sees any play with a situational minor bug gets disabled. A heavily played champion that is a contested pick in the meta with a game breaking bug is allowed to remain available for players to use to cheat with and ruin the gaming experience and competitive environment of league for the entire rest of the playerbase.

Your decisions are always extremely questionable. The reasoning you gave here for why competitive integrity of the game is allowed to remain completely non existent isn't just questionable. Its downright moronic.

I'm just saying mate...

You folks at Riot have zero sense of priority. And this happens on a daily basis for the past 6 seasons. How do you guys continue to screw up this badly on SIMPLE issues? Any other game would have just disabled the champ... because thats fucking common sense. Why are there scripters abusing this exploit? Because you allow it to remain possible for them to exploit it...

This kind of failure on something simple and small is a prime example of the ways and things on which Riot has failed for years that has made this game a low quality, unenjoyable, thoroughly frustrating thing to even play. It's no wonder the playerbase has shrunk this season and its no wonder it will continue to shrink in the coming years if you folks continue to display this level of negligence for your own creation and the playerbase that creation is meant for.
How come Graves is getting a nerf to his armor and magic resist bonus stats on his E on the PBE?
Because he deals shit tons of damage and gets super tanky while doing it. It's slightly poor design, to say the least.
To be fair, he used to gain tank stats in his passive (though less than now currently) by attacking before his rework so the design was already there.
Point being that it's taken this long for them to realize how strong free stats are.
Ah, got it. Now that I think about it though doesn't Rengar have that same issue too in his w? Though I do remember that Riot is going to remove the free tank stats once Rengar is reworked.

One dash currently is already better than his old passive while being instantly applicable in a fight, and that's without him being in a situation that allows him to double/triple/quadruple that bonus. 

His E really doesn't need such a benefit; it's not even compensating for anything in his kit since everything in there is intended to be very strong. It's kind of weird, almost as if Riot thought new Graves wouldn't be strong enough when they were testing him.

*Insert cigar joke*. Actually to be fair he did get a shortened AA range so that does put him at risk for taking more damage so that might be the reason why he has true grit in his e and he is more of an upfront marksman.

probably because not everybody is doing it? bugs with champs means that generally everybody is having the same issue, where as an exploit means 1 in xxxxxxx people are doing it.

Anyway, it's interesting to find out that there's an explanation. I've played against Graves tons of times, and I hate him regardless. I was just baffled.
